column4: you tried a f12 prompt at powering on ti get a boot menu for the usb's
it will attempt to boot from the usb key's, but it always hangs.
you have md5 summed the original iso ?
one is an official disc that's worked great in the past (it's old, 9.04).
you using the cd download on the dvd or the dvd download?
i believe it was the cd version burned to a dvd.
but i also have an official 9.04 cd from ubuntu
not sure but I think that could be a problem, I think you just have a series of shortcuts that is burning you.
i honestly don't know.  seems everything is against me today :/
wha happens when you boot the 9.04
kernel panic
you say kernel panic is it just a black screen.
no it says kernel panic, not syncing blah blah.  then the caps lock flashes constantly.  same when i try to boot 3.0.0.14 from the hdd.
so as of now it bots straight to XP?
i get the grub2 menu.  xp is the only thing that boots consistently, tho.
you can do a manual boot in I will find you a link.
here you go read carefully every space and input has to be perfect to work, took me a while to figure it out when practicing.  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Grub2#Boot_a_Specific_Kernel_Manually
thanks for the link, but that isn't my issue.  i do see the grub menu, and i can boot specific kernels.  they just all fail.
you sure it is 11.10 not 12.04 it has a kernel crash problem?
positive.
since you have a slow download I would consider a slitaz or puppy linux download both are really small, and see if you can boot either. You know whats best with what yo have though.
hrm.  ok.
how would you reinstall wuith a wubi?
it's not wubi, it's installed natively.
